thread.title: Bannon v Kushner power struggle makes Fridays interesting at W.H.
thread.title_full: Bannon v Kushner power struggle makes Fridays interesting at W.H. - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Bannon v Kushner power struggle makes Fridays interesting at W.H.
text:
It’s going to be an interesting Friday at the White House, where insiders are on pins and needles wondering what sundown will bring.
A well-placed D.C. source says it’s no coincidence that President Trump’s anti-Muslim “travel ban” broke last Friday after senior presidential advisor Jared Kushner , an observant Jew, had checked out for the day. The situation is described by our spy as “a power struggle between two senior advisers” Kushner and former Breitbart chief, Steve Bannon. 
“Everyone is working 24/7, but Jared, because of his religious views, not only can’t be in the White House, but can’t be on his phone, can’t drive his car, can’t listen to the radio — he can’t be reached,” says our whistleblower. Observant Jews are prohibited from working between sunset Friday and sunset Saturday.
We’re told that advisors sympathetic to Bannon,63, have labeled Kushner, 36, “green” and “soft” and fear that his perceived timidity brings the president to a less hawkish place.
Steve Bannon architect of travel ban from Muslim countries 
Political novice Jared Kushner, a senior advisor to the President, was observing the Jewish Sabbath during last week's executive order on the travel ban. (SAUL LOEB/AFP/Getty Images) “There’s a real power struggle in Trump’s court and Steve is doing an end run around Kushner because he has no experience ,” we’re told.
According to our source, Trump’s first Friday in the White House, a celebratory affair that came two weeks ago and coincided with the President’s inauguration , was not representative of the week that would follow.
“Jared and Ivanka (Trump) got a special dispensation from their rabbi to be out after sunset because the Secret Service insisted that separating them from the President’s security detail would be very difficult logistically,” says our insider, explaining why Friday Jan. 20 was an exception to the rule for the Donald’s daughter and son-in-law. That wasn’t the case last Friday, when all hell broke loose after the President’s unexpected executive order threw the nation’s airports into chaos.
White House advisor Steve Bannon is shaping up to be a hardball operative (Evan Vucci/AP) We’re also told that Kushner and Ivanka were surprised at the backlash last weekend when they posted a glamorous social media photo of the two of them preparing to go out Saturday night — apparently unaware of what had unfolded while they were observing the Sabbath.
Trump controversies come while Kushner observing Shabbat :report 
The photo has since been labeled Ivanka’s “Marie Antoinette Moment.” 
Trump administration reps could not immediately be reached for comment.
With Brian Niemietz 
Tags: stephen bannon jared kushner donald trump donald trump first 100 days Send a Letter to the Editor Join the Conversation: facebook Tweet
